node.title: Petrol companies report increase in thefts as prices surge
node.description: As petrol costs rise, Z Energy and Caltex have reported an increase in petrol thefts. Meanwhile, the appetite for electric vehicles appears to be gradually growing. Audio

node.title: Evacuation orders issued for several suburbs in south-western Sydney, flood threat increases
node.description: Tens of thousands of residents across a swathe of south-western Sydney suburbs have been told to evacuate immediately due to flooding concerns.

node.title: 'We've met the nicest people': Dog owners barking mad over beach ban
node.description: A new dog control bylaw in New Plymouth has got canine lovers in a spin. Audio

node.title: 'Only individuals can judge how unwell they are', nurses union says
node.description: Unions representing healthcare workers have hit back at the Ministry of Health's announcement that critical healthcare workers can return to work six days earlier if they have two negative rapid…

node.title: Putin "undeterred" by economic sanctions and military setbacks in Ukraine, U.S. intel leaders say
node.description: An "aggrieved" Putin likely "perceives this as a war he cannot afford to lose," said director of national intelligence Avril Haines.

node.title: McDonald's closes in Russia, citing "suffering" in Ukraine
node.description: World's largest fast-food chain had faced boycott calls over its continuing to run 850 restaurants in Russia.

node.title: Inflation predicted to reach 7.4 percent in second quarter - ANZ
node.description: The country's biggest bank is forecasting annual inflation to get even higher as the war in Ukraine sends commodity prices skyrocketing.

node.title: Guy Reffitt, first January 6 defendant to stand trial, found guilty on all charges
node.description: Member of the far-right militia group the Texas Three Percenters was turned into the FBI by his teenage son, who testified against him.

node.title: Watch: Party People episode 9
node.description: Party People analyses the winners and losers of Christopher Luxon's planned tax cuts, looks at the Commerce Commission's final report on supermarkets and debates the fallout over the Parliament…

node.title: Stocks swing wildly as U.S. bans Russian oil imports
node.description: The economic fallout from Russia's invasion of Ukraine kept rocking stock and oil markets around the world.

node.title: Mexico finds 11 bodies in secret burial pits near U.S. border
node.description: Volunteer search teams made up of relatives of disappeared people led authorities to the pits in a stretch of desert near a garbage dump.

node.title: Florida Senate passes controversial "Don't Say Gay" bill despite protests
node.description: The bill now heads to the desk of Gov. DeSantis, who has expressed his support.

node.title: Luxon was following all the rules - Deputy Nicola Willis
node.description: National's deputy leader Nicola Willis has defended her leader Christopher Luxon after he was filmed hugging supporters at a party event on Sunday.

node.title: Ukraine refugees "could be me or you," says IRC president
node.description: More than one million people have fled Ukraine since Russia's invasion of the country.

node.title: Biden bans Russian energy imports, targeting "main artery" of Russia's economy
node.description: "The decision today is not without cost here at home," the president said Tuesday, warning Americans to expect gas prices to climb higher.

node.title: 6 teens charged with murder in alleged drive-by shooting outside Iowa school
node.description: Police said Tuesday the 15-year-old victim was the intended target of the shooting.

node.title: U.K. weighs new law to find and seize Russian oligarchs' "dirty money"
node.description: The Economic Crime Bill is an effort to close loopholes that activists say have allowed Russians with Kremlin ties to launder their "dirty money for decades."

node.title: Leader of Proud Boys charged with conspiracy related to Jan. 6 rioting
node.description: At least a dozen Proud Boys already face charges related to the rioting.

node.title: Watching grass grow: Pensioner's wait for berm trim
node.description: They say the grass is greener on the other side of the fence, but one Rotorua pensioner just wants the council to mow her berm.

node.title: Adam Hall wins bronze in Beijing
node.description: New Zealand has won it's third medal at the Beijing Winter Paralympics with Adam Hall picking up bronze in the standing Super Combined ski event.

node.title: 'We have never seen anything like this': Thousands flee bombed Ukraine cities
node.description: "It's a disaster. These people have nothing, just one bag because they had only three minutes to run and save their lives," a Lviv city official said as thousands arrived from bombed Ukraine cities.

node.title: Auckland property values soar by up to 59 percent
node.description: Aucklanders can see their updated property values from today, with homes in Great Barrier Island soaring by 59 percent.

node.title: Orphans with disabilities fleeing Kyiv received by Poles, Hungarians
node.description: A train to Hungary carried about 200 people with physical and mental disabilities — residents of two orphanages in Kyiv that were evacuated.

node.title: Married couple stabbed to death while riding bikes home in Florida
node.description: "This is probably one of the most vicious and gruesome incidents that I've witnessed in my 20 years," the police chief said.

node.title: As COVID cases go from 1 to 24,000, New Zealand changes approach
node.description: New Zealand's approach to the virus has shifted, moving from elimination to something approaching acceptance as the omicron variant has taken hold.

node.title: U.S. citizens travel to Ukraine to help in war efforts
node.description: The Ukrainian government reports more than 16,000 foreigners have already arrived in Ukraine.

node.title: Supreme Court rejects GOP bids to block 2 states' congressional maps
node.description: In the North Carolina case, three conservative justices said they would have blocked the use of the court-approved map.

node.title: U.S. gas prices surge to all-time high as oil costs soar
node.description: California drivers are paying some of the highest prices in the U.S., with one county averaging more than $6 a gallon.

node.title: Watch Live: Biden to announce ban on Russian oil imports
node.description: The president is speaking about new moves meant to punish Russia for its invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: Florida to recommend against COVID vaccines for healthy kids
node.description: Dr. Joseph Ladapo made the announcement at a roundtable event that featured doctors who criticized COVID lockdowns and mandate policies.
